p: Thus, we can see that there are currently both top-down and bottom-up movements concerning ECEfS. In this context both the language of policy and theories and the language of everyday practices and pedagogies in ECEC can merge and each have their role to play. However, the articles in this special issue make clear that the goals and targets of the Agenda 2030 are not yet approached in a systemic and coherent way in the ECEC context, and not always leading to transformative change. We interpret this as consequence of the fact that the ideological roots of the framework are to be found in the field of politics rather than in education.
